result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wendy Dawn Owens

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Wendy Dawn Owens
Current: 829 Mason Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: 829 Mason St, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States

10:33 AM Defendant Wendy Dawn Owens in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Called 22CF85 and 22CF122. Court received report from SPD, no attorney appointed to the cases yet, will have set for another date and continues bond. Owens questions if she can address bond, asking for reduction and for bond to be reduced to refund to her mother. Court denies request to modify bond in 22CF85. 22CF122 - $2500 cash bond. State asks for bond to remain. Court will continue bond at this point on both cases. If mother wants her money back, she needs to request for it in writing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Wendy Dawn Owens
Current: 829 Mason St, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 10-10-2022)
Prior: 304 West Glen Street, Four Seasons Motel, #18, Crandon, WI 54520 United States

9:39 AM Defendant Wendy Dawn Owens in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF85 and 22CF122. Court reviews file, also appearing is Martha Danette Sevy as she has filed a request for her bond money back. Martha could not connect to zoom. Court suggests to have her send another letter requesting bond money back, if she can't figure out zoom will need to be here in person. Court has reviewed both files, no attorney yet. Owens asks for court to be set later in the day due to her work schedule. 
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report
From Richard Whiting wanting bond money to not be revoked, but to be put in Wendy Owens' mother's name.

9:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wendy Dawn Owens in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court reviews file, SPD has no attorney yet. Owens states she stays in contact with SPD. Court continues bond, sets for another AIA on 9/7/22 at 9:30 AM, keep in contact with SPD.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:46 AM Defendant Wendy Dawn Owens in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court states she contacted SPD last week and again today, informed her that she is eligible and they are still looking for an attorney. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 8/10/22 at 9:30 AM, contact SPD and let them know that the Court needs something from them stating that she is eligible and that they need to inform the court of the progress.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Wendy Dawn Owens
Current: 304 West Glen Street, Four Seasons Motel, #18, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2022)
Prior: P.O. Box 280, 5363 Linden Street, Laona, WI 54541 United States

3:27 PM. Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wendy Dawn Owens in court.  Court recalled from this morning, believes defendant called yesterday to adjourn, today called because car broke down and questions defendant. Ownes makes statement, broke down in Pulaski, were in Green Bay, unable to find ride, had job interviews in GB. Court reviews file, is eligible for SPD. Owens indicates she couldn't get ahold of SPD. Court frustrated and instructs to call SPD everyday, if not eligible advises of court appointed attorney. Court will vacate warrant, sets aside forfeiture and reinstates bond. Set for another date. Court advises if change of address, must notify court.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Wendy Dawn Owens
Current: P.O. Box 280, 5363 Linden Street, Laona, WI 54541 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2022)
Prior: P.O. Box 280, Laona, WI 54541 United States

9:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas H.L. Barfell not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court has Clerk put on the record the conversation that the Clerk of Court's Office with Wendy Owens as it relates to her court appearance and the defendant's appearance (asked for an adjournment yesterday - Clerk's Office denies that, Owens called this morning stating that their car broke down and again asked for an adjournment stating that they moved to Green Bay). Court finds that the excuses stated by Ms. Owens is a scam to the Court and will not accept it, also notes that the case indicates that Ms. Owen and Mr. Barfell reside in Laona and neither party has updated the Court/DA's office of a change in address which is in violation of their bond conditions. State asks for forfeiture of any bond posted - bench warrant body or $1,000.00. Court so orders.

9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wendy Dawn Owens in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Owens does have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Owens understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, will contact SPD, makes mention that she asks for a reduction in another case that is not filed yet. Court is only dealing with this case today. State - will be summomsed on the new case. Courts sets for AIA on 7/6/22 at 9:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
